author: stsp
msg: (parse_addresses): Fall back to unspecified addresses if none are
provided.  Small whitespace fix.  Fix parsing of multiple addresses
by copying the host string of parsed addresses into the proper pool.
(init_listeners): Do not error out anymore when no addresses
(main): Don't bother initialising the addresses array if
no addresses are provided. This is now done in parse_addresses().

author: stsp
msg: (main): Do not attempt to close an unitialised socket.
Add a TODO comment for Win32.
This commit introduces a warning (unused variable 'sock'),
but I'll leave that in for now since it serves as a reminder
that the Windows code is still broken.

author: stsp
msg: and --listen-port options by using apr_psprintf() instead of an
svn_stringbuf_t to combine host and port arguments.

author: stsp
msg: Make code more beautiful by getting rid of a global variable.
As a nice side-effect, this change enforces the order in which
init_listeners() and wait_for_client() should be called.
(listeners): Get rid of this global variable scum.
(init_listeners): Return initialised listeners in an array.
(main): Pass listeners array between init_listeners() and
